Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Enthusiastic \En*thu`si*as"tic\, Enthusiastical \En*thu`si*as"tic*al\, a. [Gr. ? .] Filled with enthusiasm; characterized by enthusiasm; zealous; as, an enthusiastic lover of art. ``Enthusiastical raptures.'' --Calamy. -- {En*thu`si*as"tic*al*ly}, adv. [1913 Webster]
A young man . . . of a visionary and enthusiastic character. --W. Irving. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Enthusiastic \En*thu`si*as"tic\, n. An enthusiast; a zealot. [Obs.]

enthusiastic adj : having or showing great excitement and interest; "enthusiastic crowds filled the streets"; "an enthusiastic response"; "was enthusiastic about taking ballet lessons" [ant: {unenthusiastic}]
